subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: speed
msgSnippet: If you are in a hurry, an ABC system based on longhand, such as Speedwriting, Forkner, Alphahand, or Personal Shorthand are all easy to learn and fast enuf for
messageBody:
If you are in a hurry, an ABC system based on longhand, such as Speedwriting, Forkner, Alphahand, or Personal Shorthand are all easy to learn and fast enuf for notetaking in class or meetings.  You can be fluent in most of the ABC systems in abt six wks.
 
If you have abt six months to study and practice, the easiest to learn and use is Callendar's Cursive Orthographic.  A slightly more complex, but very pretty and easy to write is Sweet's Cursive Orthographic Shorthand.  Both use longhand spelling, so are easy to learn.  The words all stay btwn the lines, and in the case of Sweet's Current, is very nearly as lineal as longhand.  Handywrite is essentiallly based on Greg, and is even harder and more time-consuming to learn. 
 
Quikscript is also fast enuf for notetaking, if you use the Senior form.  It does take a lot of practice to learn to anticipate when the letters join and to use the alternate forms.
 
Good luck.
 
Harry
----- Original Message -----
From: matthew smith
To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, September 13, 2006 3:27 PM
Subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: speed

thank you for your input i think that i will learn both and see which i like better

Hermann Philipps <hphilipps@onlinehom e.de> wrote:

Although Quikscript is faster than ordinary letters (once you are used
to it) it may not be sufficiently fast for really speedy writing. You
could try Handywrite (http://www.alysion. org/handy/ handywrite. htm). It
works without different pencil pressures.

Hermann

--- In Read_Alphabet@ yahoogroups. com, "nerd_the_mighty"
<nerd_the_mighty@ ...> wrote:
>
> hi im new to this group and am wondering about whether quickscript is
> a good thing to use for speed (when handwriten) because i am trying to
> find a fast way to take notes for classes ive looked into pittman
> gregg and teeline but i dont like them any suggestions on types to
> write if quickscript is not fast written
>
